items.name: Schrödinger's Spectacles
items.description: These glasses simultaneously show radiation as both particles and waves. You'll either understand everything or nothing—or both simultaneously!

effect.value: 50% chance to automatically ace any quantum physics question or completely fail it

items.name: Existential Crisis Dosimeter
items.description: Measures not just radiation but the crushing weight of cosmic insignificance. Beeps louder the more you contemplate your place in the universe.

effect.value: When hit with existential dread (or radiation), converts 50% of damage into Insight

items.name: Nihilist's Clipboard
items.description: A clipboard that occasionally whispers 'None of these measurements matter in the grand scheme of things' but still helps you organize your data.

effect.value: +15 Insight and the ability to occasionally peek into the void

items.name: Camus' Absurdity Amplifier
items.description: Reveals the fundamental absurdity in medical physics protocols. Makes you laugh uncontrollably during serious meetings.

effect.value: Transforms mundane physics into philosophical questions. 30% boost on all questions if you embrace the absurd.

items.name: Sisyphus' Pocket Calculator
items.description: Calculates radiation doses perfectly, but erases its memory every time you look away. The eternal struggle of medical physics incarnate.

effect.value: Gain 5 Insight every time you redo a calculation you've already done

items.name: Event Horizon Coffee Thermos
items.description: Contains coffee so dark and dense that light cannot escape. Time dilates when you drink it, giving you extra moments to think.

effect.value: Once per floor, stop time briefly to avoid failing a question

items.name: Imposter Syndrome Lab Coat
items.description: A pristine lab coat that makes you feel like you don't deserve to wear it. Paradoxically, your insecurity makes you triple-check all your work.

effect.value: +15% accuracy on difficult questions because you're paranoid about making mistakes

items.name: Cosmic Joke Detector
items.description: Originally designed to detect cosmic rays, this device has become sentient and now only detects cosmic ironies in your career choices.

effect.value: Gain 3 Insight whenever you fail a question, because the universe is laughing with you, not at you

items.name: Mr. Curie The Radioactive Teddy Bear
items.description: A slightly glowing teddy bear that provides emotional support during difficult cases. May or may not be the result of a radiotherapy accident.

effect.value: +1 Maximum Life and whispers therapeutic radiation doses in your ear

items.name: Quantum Foam Stress Ball
items.description: A stress ball made of actual quantum foam. Probability waves emanate from it when squeezed, making unlikely outcomes slightly more likely.

effect.value: Once per floor, reroll the outcome of any random event

items.name: Infinite Improbability Dosimeter
items.description: Stolen from a heart-of-gold spaceship, this device occasionally transforms radiation into something improbable, like marshmallows or singing whales.

effect.value: 10% chance to transform any question into an absurdly easy one about towels

items.name: Waiting for Godot Pager
items.description: A pager that never actually beeps. You spend your whole shift waiting for it, contemplating the meaninglessness of on-call duty.

effect.value: Cannot be called for emergencies, giving you 20% more time to answer questions

items.name: 11-Dimensional Measuring Stick
items.description: Measures not just length, width, and height, but also time, probability, and several dimensions you can't perceive. Accidentally pokes holes in spacetime.

effect.value: +25% on measurements, but occasionally teleports you to parallel department meetings

items.name: Laplace's Deterministic Dice
items.description: Dice that always roll exactly what you need because the universe is predetermined. Makes probability calculations pointless yet always correct.

effect.value: All insight gains are exactly what you need, no more, no less

items.name: Groundhog Day Wristwatch
items.description: A watch that occasionally sends you back in time to repeat the same clinical scenario until you get it right. Or until you go insane.

effect.value: Once per floor, retry a failed question without penalty

items.name: Rick's Immortality Field Micro-Generator
items.description: A tiny device that temporarily prevents death in a small radius. Battery life is questionable, and side effects may include nihilistic outbursts.

effect.value: Cannot die from the first fatal error on each floor. Instead, you just feel intense existential pain.

items.name: Heisenberg Compensator Badge
items.description: A Star Trek-inspired badge that makes impossible measurements possible. Still doesn't work with hospital WiFi though.

effect.value: +20% on quantum physics questions, but -10% on practical networking problems

items.name: Second Law Violation Pen
items.description: A pen that violates the second law of thermodynamics, allowing you to un-write mistakes. The universe really hates when you use it.

effect.value: Erase one wrong answer per day, but cosmic balance demands something in return

items.name: Pocket Singularity
items.description: A contained black hole the size of a marble. Perfect for disposing of embarrassing research papers or creating exotic physics demonstrations.

effect.value: +30% on astrophysics questions, and you can dramatically dispose of incorrect answers

items.name: Imaginary Number Radiation Detector
items.description: Detects radiation in imaginary dimensions. Readings make no practical sense but are mathematically beautiful.

effect.value: Gain insight from mathematical beauty rather than practical application

items.name: Schrödinger's Lunchbox
items.description: A lunchbox that contains food in a superposition of states: both delicious and disgusting until you observe it. Comes with quantum-entangled napkins.

effect.value: 50% chance that any penalty becomes a reward instead

items.name: Infinite Monkey Theorem Calculator
items.description: Contains millions of tiny simulated monkeys typing on tiny keyboards. Eventually produces correct calculations among the gibberish.

effect.value: Given enough time, will solve any problem. -30% on timed questions, +50% on take-home problems.

items.name: Half-Life: The Pet Rock
items.description: A mildly radioactive pet rock that has been decaying for exactly one half-life. It teaches patience and statistics simultaneously.

effect.value: +2 Insight every time you correctly answer a decay calculation

items.name: Literal Beam Hardener
items.description: Instead of filtering low-energy photons, this device shows X-ray beams motivational posters to toughen them up emotionally.

effect.value: +15% on radiation therapy questions. Beams are more confident but slightly more aggressive.

items.name: Dark Matter Coffee Creamer
items.description: Makes your coffee inexplicably heavier but impossible to actually see in the mug. Provides energy through unknown mechanisms.

effect.value: +1 Maximum Life, but occasionally your coffee mug will develop its own gravitational field
